metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2938 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's implementation of Pressure Stall Information. While the feature is disabled by default, it could allow an attacker to crash the system or have other memory-corruption side effects.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-109-generic - 5.4.0-109.123
linux-image-5.4.0-109-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-109.123
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-109-generic - 5.4.0-109.123
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-109-lowlatency - 5.4.0-109.123
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1072-aws - 5.4.0-1072.77
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1014-aws - 5.15.0-1014.18~20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> on s390x/focal and newer, CONFIG_PSI_DEFAULT_DISABLED is set (see LP: #1876044), so requires a boot command line argument; other arches have it enabled.
